definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
abbr. for Xiamen or Amoy 廈門|厦门[Xia4 men2], Fujian

sentences.english: Did they do this a long time ago?
sentences.chinese: 他们在很久以前建造摩天大厦吗？

sentences.english: Nancy:And it's one of the most famous buildings in the world, it was the first skyscraper.
sentences.chinese: 它是世界著名的建筑物之一，是第一座摩天大厦。

sentences.english: Skyscrapers are also lavish consumers, and wasters, of electric power.
sentences.chinese: 摩天大厦，也有豪华的消费者，和废物，电力等。

sentences.english: The majesty of the skyscraper awed me .
sentences.chinese: 这幢摩天大厦的雄伟气势令我惊叹。

sentences.english: The first modern-style skyscraper rose a stubby ten stories above Chicago's streets.
sentences.chinese: 摩天大厦在芝加哥的大街上升起矮墩墩的十层。

sentences.english: A skyscraper built on a base of solid rock.
sentences.chinese: 市中心又建起了一座摩天大厦。

definition: tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
Jin Mao Tower, skyscraper in Shanghai
Burj Khalifa, skyscraper in Dubai, 830 m high
a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
